This was the best team shooter game ever made. It sucked up about 6 years of my life. It was that good. The only drawback is that it needs other human players to still be fun.  Team Fortress 2 killed its user base. As of 1/16/19, there are only 3 servers left with enough humans players on them to make the game still any fun. But all these servers have issues. Drippys 2fort is a one-map wonder, and the server owner is a ban freak.  The EVIL Battlezone server has too many map rotations that keep it from being fun and the humans leave after the map changes. Lastly, there is a Human vs Bot server that gets pretty boring.  So there just aren't any more servers or humans left for this game to be played the way it was intended and the way it used to be played before 2007.  This game should be given away for free now due to the lack of regular players.

Really solid game.

The only advice I would give you is not to go on to Slippy's 2fort. The server is really toxic to new players, especially coming from TF2. Any other server is nice and helpful to new players for the most part.

Unlike most of the player base that joins around Christmas, I bought the game with TF2 barely in my mind. This game offers some great fast paced gameplay and gets better once you understand how each class works. I recommend it if you’re looking for a game that is a little more on the challenging side but is also a frickin blast. I also suggest not to go into it with TF2 in mind, it will ruin the whole experience.

Meet Team Fortress Classic the port of original mod for Quake to the Gold Source engine. The game is still alive with a dedicated community of players and lots of servers to play on. Just don't be surpised when you get fragged by stray player's grenades that you may come across.

Still hold's relevency even in today's modern gaming, would recommend for people who like adventure maps or who just want a good fps battle game. The textures and models are nostalgic and a good clean 90's feel, with fun mechanics to discover for the adventure seeking players. [b]feckin-mad.co.uk - [FM] Fun Server[/b] has a lot of good adventure and practice maps

The very first online game I ever got into all the way back in 2001. I couldn't tell you how many thousands of hours I poured into this game. Sure it's old now and there are only a couple of decent servers running, but, if you can look over the dated graphics or even love the timeless half-life engine visuals, I guarantee that you will have fun on this game.

For less than £1, you can take a trip back to the 90s and see how things were in the good ol' days where toxic, raging teenagers were rarer than hen's teeth!

To say this game hasn't aged well is an understatement. With Team Fortress 2 being free with much more content and a higher playerbase, the only reason you should get this game is if you buy the Valve Complete Pack or have fond memories of this game from years past.

It was ok when it came out, but is aged horribly. Team Fortress Classic has become obsolete by the release of Team Fortress 2. There is nothing about the original game that hasn’t been done 10 times better by its successor. For a Valve multiplayer classic that has aged better than this, check out Day of Defeat or Half-Life Multiplayer.

This game still holds up on it's own.
Im sorta sick of TFC players dogging on TF2 and vise versa.
These communities need to lay off each other, because these games are NOT the same.
Just because they are in the same series means nothing.
While TF2 is about working as a team and stragedy, this game is about how fast a medic can throw himself across the map. No offense, but anyone that didn't just start is playing medic for some reason.
kinda miss how you can toss unneeded ammo at team mates, that will always be helpful, should have been in TF2.
The community is great, mainly full of helpful team mates and flag runners that have been playing for years. Im glad when you join for the first time, your team doesn't shame you for being new like the TF2 community does.
Really sucks how none of my friends like playing this game that much, this game is "compatitble" with my awful internet. so I find myself playing this game alot now.

Classic game. Not too fancy, but well done.

Think TF2 but without the ADHD, or its lovely community of screaming children and hackers, or the much loved micro-transactions. 
Also Spies *disguise* themselves as the Opposite Team here, rather than the cheap option of going invisible. 

Maybe it's just nostalgia bias, but I enjoy the TF2 cinematics more than playing the actual game.

Team Fortress Classic still holds up pretty well despitethe sequel overshadowing it

Pros
The gamplay is super fast and chaotic
There are a variety of classes to pick from some easier to learn than others but their all useful
The weapons all look good

Cons
I now understand why TF2 dosen't have grenades they are mega annoying
Some charectors have repeat weapons the soldier has 2 shotguns and the snipers machine gun looks just like his sniping rifle 
Why do you spawn with your armor and ammo unfilled? This just means I have to waste a few seconds stocking in the spawn spot
Considering how quickly and easily you can die you'd think you could find health and armor pickups outside the spawn spot but no you just need to have a medic or play defensevly around the spawn point

So overall even though a few things annoy me this game still holds up and I'd reccomend it
